docs.lead_paragraph: The U.S. government is expected to announce this week the proposed payment rates for insurer-run Medicare plans in 2015, but industry officials say the anticipated cuts will mean higher co-pays and fewer benefits for seniors.

headline.main: U.S. Health Insurers Brace for New Steep Medicare Cuts
headline.print_headline: U.S. Health Insurers Brace for New Steep Medicare Cuts

docs.snippet: The U.S. government is expected to announce this week the proposed payment rates for insurer-run Medicare plans in 2015, but industry officials say the anticipated cuts will mean higher co-pays and fewer benefits for seniors.

docs.lead_paragraph: The State House for a second day in a row defeated a compromise plan to expand Medicaid by using federal Medicaid funds to buy private insurance for low-income residents.
docs.snippet: The State House for a second day in a row defeated a compromise plan to expand Medicaid by using federal Medicaid funds to buy private insurance for low-income residents.

docs.lead_paragraph: The state-run online marketplace did not offer applications in Spanish until late December, and a Spanish-language site was dogged by translation errors.

headline.main: California Health Insurance Enrollments Rise, but Hispanics Still Lag
headline.print_headline: California Health Enrollments Rise, but Hispanics Still Lag

docs.abstract: California officials say more than 828,000 residents have signed up for private coverage through the state's online health care exchange, with six weeks left in the open enrollment period for insurance under Pres Obama's health care law, but enrollment still lags among state's Hispanics.
docs.snippet: The state-run online marketplace did not offer applications in Spanish until late December, and a Spanish-language site was dogged by translation errors.

docs.lead_paragraph: Vice President Joe Biden acknowledged on Wednesday that it will be hard to reach the target on the number of people signing up for health insurance by a looming March 31 deadline for Obamacare enrollment.

headline.main: Biden: 'We May Not Get to 7 Million' by Obamacare Deadline
headline.print_headline: Biden: 'We May Not Get to 7 Million' by Obamacare Deadline

docs.snippet: Vice President Joe Biden acknowledged on Wednesday that it will be hard to reach the target on the number of people signing up for health insurance by a looming March 31 deadline for Obamacare enrollment.

docs.lead_paragraph: Vice President Joe Biden said Wednesday that it would be a good start for the federal health care law if 5 million to 6 million people sign up by the end of March, an acknowledgement that enrollments might fall significantly short of the Obama administration's unofficial target of 7 million.

docs.lead_paragraph: Arkansas legislators have defeated for a second day in a row a compromise plan to expand Medicaid by purchasing private insurance, leaving the state's health program for poor residents in jeopardy.

headline.main: Ark. Legislators Vote Down Medicaid Bill Again
headline.print_headline: Ark. Legislators Vote Down Medicaid Bill Again

docs.lead_paragraph: The head of the Congress' budget agency on Wednesday defended its findings that President Barack Obama's proposed minimum wage increase would cause job losses, a day after the White House criticized the agency's methodology.

headline.main: Budget Agency Defends Wage Report After White House Criticism
headline.print_headline: Budget Agency Defends Wage Report After White House Criticism

headline.main: The Employer Mandate: Dukakis All Over Again

docs.abstract: The delays in carrying out various aspects of the Affordable Care Act are eerily similar to those of a Massachusetts health care law passed in 1988 at the urging of Gov. Michael Dukakis, an economist writes.
docs.snippet: The delays in carrying out various aspects of the Affordable Care Act are eerily similar to those of a Massachusetts health care law passed in 1988 at the urging of Gov. Michael Dukakis, an economist writes.

docs.lead_paragraph: The Arkansas House failed Tuesday to renew the state’s compromise Medicaid expansion plan, leaving in limbo a program heralded as a model for Republican-leaning states to implement the federal health overhaul.

docs.lead_paragraph: Some psychiatrists are teaching pediatricians how to evaulate children’s mental health issues like attention deficit hyperactivity disorder, which some doctors diagnose despite having little training.

headline.main: Doctors Train to Spot Signs of A.D.H.D. in Children
headline.print_headline: Doctors Train to Spot Signs of A.D.H.D. in Children

docs.abstract: Some psychiatrists are teaching pediatricians how to evaluate children’s mental health issues like attention deficit hyperactivity disorder, which some doctors diagnose despite having little training; Centers for Disease Control and Prevention says one in seven children in the United States, and almost 20 percent of all boys, receives diagnosis of ADHD by time they turn 18.
